verses.verse: Who is this who comes<WH935> from Edom,<WH123> with dyed<WH2556> garments<WH899> from Bozrah?<WH1224> this who is glorious<WH1921> in his clothing,<WH3830> marching<WH6808> in the greatness<WH7230> of his strength?<WH3581> "It is I who speak<WH1696> in righteousness,<WH6666> mighty<WH7227> to save.<WH3467>"
Why are you red<WH122> in your clothing,<WH3830> and your garments<WH899> like him who treads<WH1869> in the wine vat?<WH1660>

"I have trodden<WH1869> the winepress<WH6333> alone;<WH5971> and of the peoples there was no<WH376> man with me:<WH1869> yes, I trod them in my anger,<WH639> and trampled<WH7429> them in my wrath;<WH2534> and their lifeblood<WH5332> is sprinkled<WH5137> on my garments,<WH899> and I have stained<WH1351> all my clothing.<WH4403>
For the day<WH3117> of vengeance<WH5359> was in my heart,<WH3820> and the year<WH8141> of my redeemed<WH1350> has come.<WH935>

I looked,<WH5027> and there was none to help;<WH5826> and I wondered<WH8074> that there was none to uphold:<WH5564> therefore my own arm<WH2220> brought salvation<WH3467> to me;<WH2534> and my wrath, it upheld me.<WH5564>
I trod down<WH947> the peoples<WH5971> in my anger,<WH639> and made them drunk<WH7937> in my wrath,<WH2534> and I poured<WH3381> out their lifeblood<WH5332> on the earth.<WH776>"

I will make mention<WH2142> of the loving kindnesses<WH2617> of Yahweh<WH3068> and the praises<WH8416> of Yahweh,<WH3068> according to all that Yahweh<WH3068> has bestowed<WH1580> on us,<WH7227> and the great goodness<WH2898> toward the house<WH1004> of Israel,<WH3478> which he has bestowed<WH1580> on them according to his mercies,<WH7356> and according to the multitude<WH7230> of his loving kindnesses.<WH2617>
For he said,<WH559> "Surely,<WH5971> they are my people, children<WH1121> who will not deal falsely:<WH8266>" so he was their Savior.<WH3467>

In all their affliction<WH6869> he was afflicted,<WH6862> and the angel<WH4397> of his presence<WH6440> saved<WH3467> them:<WH160> in his love and in his pity<WH2551> he redeemed<WH1350> them;<WH5190> and he bore them,<WH5375> and carried them all the days<WH3117> of old.<WH5769>
But they rebelled,<WH4784> and grieved<WH6087> his holy<WH6944> Spirit:<WH7307> therefore he was turned<WH2015> to be their enemy,<WH341> and he himself fought against them.<WH3898>

Then he remembered<WH2142> the days<WH3117> of old,<WH5769> Moses<WH4872> and his people,<WH5971> saying,<WH5927> Where is he who brought them up out of the sea<WH3220> with the shepherds<WH7462> of his flock?<WH6629> where is he who put<WH7760> his holy<WH6944> Spirit<WH7307> in their midst?<WH7130>

who caused his glorious<WH8597> arm<WH2220> to go<WH3212> at the right hand<WH3225> of Moses?<WH4872> who divided<WH1234> the waters<WH4325> before<WH6440> them,<WH6213> to make himself an everlasting<WH5769> name?<WH8034>
who led<WH3212> them through the depths,<WH8415> as a horse<WH5483> in the wilderness,<WH4057> so that they didn't<WH3782> stumble?

As the livestock<WH929> that go down<WH3381> into the valley,<WH1237> the Spirit<WH7307> of Yahweh<WH3068> caused them to rest;<WH5117> so you led<WH5090> your people,<WH5971> to make<WH6213> yourself a glorious<WH8597> name.<WH8034>

Look<WH7200> down<WH5027> from heaven,<WH8064> and see<WH7200> from the habitation<WH2073> of your holiness<WH6944> and of your glory:<WH8597> where are your zeal<WH7068> and your mighty<WH1369> acts?<WH1995> the yearning of your heart<WH4578> and your compassion is restrained toward me.<WH662>

For<WH3588> you are our Father,<WH1> though Abraham<WH85> doesn't<WH3808> know us,<WH3478> and Israel does not acknowledge<WH5234> us:<WH3068> you, Yahweh, are our Father;<WH1> our Redeemer<WH1350> from everlasting<WH5769> is your name.<WH8034>

O Yahweh,<WH3068> why do you make us to err<WH8582> from your ways,<WH1870> and harden<WH7188> our heart<WH3820> from your fear?<WH3374> Return<WH7725> for your servants<WH5650>' sake,<WH7626> the tribes of your inheritance.<WH5159>
Your holy<WH6944> people<WH5971> possessed<WH3423> it but a little while:<WH4705> our adversaries<WH6862> have trodden down<WH947> your sanctuary.<WH4720>
We have become as they over whom you never<WH5769> bear rule,<WH4910> as those who were not called<WH7121> by your name.<WH8034>
